instructions.name: acceptAccess
docs: airdrop a token that allows users to create products in a specific marketplace

instructions.name: airdropAccess
docs: airdrop a token that allows users to create products in a specific marketplace

instructions.name: editProduct
docs: seller can edit payment_mint and product_price

instructions.name: editMarketplace
docs: marketplace authority can edit fees and rewards configs

instructions.name: initBounty
docs: marketplace auth can create multiple bounty vaults (different mints)

instructions.name: initMarketplace
docs: recommeded to read the Marketplace state code to understand the meaning of this data structure

instructions.name: initProductTree
docs: recommeded to read the Product state code to understand the meaning of this data structure

instructions.name: initProduct
docs: recommeded to read the Product state code to understand the meaning of this data structure

instructions.name: initRewardVault
docs: if a marketplace wants to change the reward mint, sellers and buyers have to create a new vault
because there is only one PDA, reward is the authority of these vaults

accounts.name: marketplaceTransferVault
docs: ATA that receives fees

instructions.name: registerBuyCounter
docs: manages the transfers (buyer -> seller and fees to marketplace authority)
initializes the payment account to get the number of purchases

accounts.name: marketplaceTransferVault
docs: ATA that receives fees

instructions.name: registerBuyToken
docs: manages the transfers (buyer -> seller and fees to marketplace authority)
and buyers receive a token as a proof of payment (each product has its own tokenc)

accounts.name: marketplaceTransferVault
docs: ATA that receives fees

instructions.name: registerBuy
docs: manages the transfers (buyer -> seller and fees to marketplace authority)
uses payment pda to index transactions, but it does not initilize it

accounts.name: marketplaceTransferVault
docs: ATA that receives fees

instructions.name: requestAccess
docs: creates on chain request to get access to sell products in a specific marketplace

instructions.name: updateTree
docs: creates on chain request to get access to sell products in a specific marketplace

instructions.name: withdrawReward
docs: when promotion is ended users can withdraw the funds stored in the vaults and managed by the reward PFA

accounts.name: Marketplace
docs: This account represents a marketplace with associated transaction fees and reward configurations.
The account is controlled by an authority that can modify the fee and reward configurations.

fields.name: authority
docs: The authorized entity that can modify this account data.

fields.name: tokenConfig
docs: Token or indexing and access system work.

fields.name: permissionConfig
docs: Set of permission configuration on a marketplace that can be modified by the authority.

fields.name: feesConfig
docs: Set of fee configuration that can be modified by the authority.

fields.name: rewardsConfig
docs: Set of rewards configuration that can be modified by the authority.

fields.name: bumps
docs: Seed bump parameters used for deterministic address derivation.

accounts.name: Product
docs: This account works as an product administrator

fields.name: authority
docs: The seller's public key, who owns the product.

fields.name: firstId
docs: Off chain identifier of the product, split across two arrays due to a limit on
the maximum size of a seed component and with the goal of use 64 byte id

fields.name: productMint
docs: Two options:
- Collection address
- Mint (fungible) that represents the product. Owning this token implies having paid for the product.

fields.name: merkleTree
docs: Active merkle tree, a seller has a limited sells so when the tree is full it is needed to update this address
can be null in case the product is created with create_product, to create a new one it is needed to call update_tree

fields.name: sellerConfig
docs: Seller-defined product configurations.

fields.name: bumps
docs: Seed bump parameters used for deterministic address derivation.

fields.name: authority
docs: The public key of the account having authority over the reward PDA.

fields.name: marketplace
docs: The marketplace address, stored to derive reward pda in the context.

fields.name: rewardVaults
docs: Vault where tokens are stored until promotion is ended, then the user can withdraw.
reward_mint is stored in marketplace account.
It is allowed to create 5 vaults with different mints. In init_reward one is created,
if you want to change the mint reward for your users you need to makes user sign a init_bounty ix

fields.name: bumps
docs: Seed bump parameter used for deterministic address derivation in case of the Reward account.

fields.name: authority
docs: The user pubkey that request access to the marketplace.

fields.name: marketplace
docs: The marketplace address, stored to derive access pda in the context.

accounts.name: Payment
docs: its a pda from signer, marketplace and product can only be
created/modified in register_buy that requieres transfers

types.name: TokenConfig
docs: Marketplace permission configs, gives flexibility to this program, marketplace auth decides.
All properties = false, buyer can call only register_buy instruction

fields.name: useCnfts
docs: If true seller inits the tree and buyers receives a cnft as a proof of payment
ie: seller calls init_product_tree to list a product and buyer calls register_buy_cnft

fields.name: deliverToken
docs: If true when someone buys a product, he receives a fungible token as proof of payment
false, payment account (just a counter) its created to keep track of amount of units bought

fields.name: transferable
docs: If true the fungible token can be transferable, ie: a user can sell it

fields.name: chainCounter
docs: If true payment account is created (pda used to index ALL transactions), init that account means having
a counter of the times a user has bought a specific product (should be cheaper vs using a token)

types.name: PermissionConfig
docs: Marketplace permission configs, gives flexibility to this program, marketplace auth decides.

fields.name: permissionless
docs: True = permissionless marketplace, false = only wallets with a specific token can create products.

types.name: FeesConfig
docs: Marketplace fees related to transactions.

fields.name: discountMint
docs: Marketplaces can set a mint. Sellers opting to receive this mint as payment
will have their marketplace fee reduced. This could be a governance token, for instance.

fields.name: fee
docs: The transaction fee percentage levied by the app or marketplace.
For example, a value of 250 corresponds to a fee of 2.5%.

fields.name: feeReduction
docs: Fee reduction percentage applied if the seller chooses to receive a specific token as payment.

fields.name: feePayer
docs: The entity that pays the transaction fees (either the buyer or the seller).

types.name: RewardsConfig
docs: Rewards configuration associated with sales.
1. marketplace auth init_market (with one bounty_vault)
2. if a marketplace wants to change the reward mint, needs to call init_bounty_vault with that mint
3. marketplace auth transfers manually the bounty tokens (can be with 1/2 in the same transaction)
4. user sells / buys during promo in the marketplace, sends some tokens to the reward_vault of both
seller and buyer these vaults are controlled by marketplace pda
5. when promotion is ended the user can withdraw the rewards

fields.name: rewardMint
docs: If set, the marketplace will only give rewards if the payment is made with this specific mint.
To enable rewards irrespective of payment mint, set this value to pda(b"null", this program).

fields.name: bountyVaults
docs: Vaults where reward tokens are stored.
These vaults are managed by this marketplace PDA.
Tokens used during the promotional period should be deposited here.

fields.name: sellerReward
docs: The transaction volume percentage that the seller receives as a reward on a sale.
A value of 250 corresponds to a reward of 2.5% of the transaction volume.
A value of 0 indicates that there is no active rewards for the seller.

fields.name: buyerReward
docs: The transaction volume percentage that the buyer receives as a reward on a sale.

fields.name: rewardsEnabled
docs: This flag enables or disables the reward system.
When false, the reward system is inactive regardless of the reward_mint value.

types.name: MarketplaceBumps
docs: Bump seed parameters used for deterministic address derivation.

fields.name: paymentMint
docs: The token seller selects to receive as payment.

fields.name: productPrice
docs: The product price in terms of payment token/mint.

errors.name: CannotCloseProduct
errors.msg: There are still users with active payments

errors.name: StringTooLong
errors.msg: You are providing a string that is too long

errors.name: NumericalOverflow
errors.msg: Numerical Overflow happened

errors.name: IncorrectFee
errors.msg: You are setting a higher fee than allowed

errors.name: InconrrectAppAccount
errors.msg: You are providing a wrong app account

errors.name: InconrrectCreatorAccount
errors.msg: You are providing a wrong creator vault

errors.name: IncorrectPaymentMint
errors.msg: You are trying to pay a different mint than the one stated by the seller

errors.name: IncorrectATA
errors.msg: You are providing a wrong associated token account

errors.name: IncorrectAuthority
errors.msg: You are not the authority

errors.name: IncorrectMint
errors.msg: You are providing an incorrect mint

errors.name: IncorrectNonce
errors.msg: Given nonce is invalid

errors.name: IncorrectSeeds
errors.msg: Incorrect seeds

errors.name: IncorrectGovernanceName
errors.msg: You are not allowed to create a governance account

errors.name: IncorrectTokenProgram
errors.msg: You are providing a wrong token program

errors.name: IncorrectInstruction
errors.msg: You are trying to sign an incorrect instruction based on marketplace configuration

errors.name: ConversionError
errors.msg: Failed to convert data

errors.name: TransferError
errors.msg: Transfer error

errors.name: MintToError
errors.msg: Error during the mint_to CPI

errors.name: BurnError
errors.msg: Error during the burn CPI

errors.name: CloseAccountError
errors.msg: Error during the close account CPI

errors.name: ClosedPromotion
errors.msg: Currently we do not offer any promotion

errors.name: OpenPromotion
errors.msg: Currently you can not withdraw the bonus because the promotion has not finished

errors.name: VaultsVectorFull
errors.msg: The max size of reward vaults are set at 5

errors.name: ExtensionNotSupported
errors.msg: Currently this extension is not supported

errors.name: CreateAccountError
errors.msg: Error creating mint account

errors.name: MintExtensionError
errors.msg: Error extension init

errors.name: InitMintError
errors.msg: Error mint init

errors.name: OptionalAccountNotProvided
errors.msg: Optional account not provided

errors.name: NotInWithelist
errors.msg: You dont have the token that allows you to create products
